title: Warning left-wing ‘Blob’ will plot to ruin chances of sending migrants to Rwanda
description: There are fears civil servants could attempt to run down the clock and wreck the plan to send asylum seekers to Rwanda.

title: Starmer turns to City spinner with links to Gordon Brown to broker pre-election FTSE summit
description: Sir Keir Starmer has enlisted one of the most well connected men in the City of London to broker a meeting of FTSE 100 chief executives ahead of next year’s general election. Sir Keir has “partnered” with Sir Alan Parker, the founder of PR firm Brunswick, to host a summit with company chiefs next month as the Labour leader courts business.

title: Anyone living near a new electricity pylon set to get £10,000 off bills
description: Chancellor Jeremy Hunt is to announce the change which aims to reduce planning objections to new power projects

title: Corbyn calls Hamas ‘terrorist group’ and adds Israel behind ‘acts of terror too’
description: Jeremy Corbyn has described Hamas as a “terrorist group” after avoiding the term on Piers Morgan: Uncensored, as he wrote an article accusing the Israeli army of being guilty of “acts of terror too”.

title: Sarwar refuses to say if he would have backed ceasefire vote
description: Anas Sarwar has repeatedly refused to say if he would have defied his party’s UK leader and supported an amendment at Westminster which called for a ceasefire in Gaza. The Scottish Labour leader, in a bad-tempered interview on BBC Scotland’s The Sunday Show,

title: Peace campaigners across the world demand a ceasefire in Gaza
description: PEACE campaigners across Britain joined demonstrations across the world to demand a ceasefire in Gaza as the Palestinian Red Crescent Society evacuated 31 premature babies from the “death zone” al-Shifa hospital today.

title: ‘Stop Genocide in Gaza’: Pro-Palestinian demonstrators rally across Europe

title: Labour hires City PR firm Brunswick to build ties with big business
description: Labour leader Sir Keir Starmer is reportedly set to work with top City PR firm Brunswick to try and build better relationships with FTSE 100 companies.

title: Humza Yousaf: Brother-in-law tells of ‘death and destruction’ in Gaza
description: Humza Yousaf has described how his brother-in-law, a hospital doctor in the Gaza strip, has witnessed “death and destruction” in the ongoing war. Mr Yousaf said his brother-in-law is in a “terrible way” as he continues to treat patients in the south of Gaza.

title: The sight of Lord Cameron strutting the world stage won’t save Rishi Sunak
description: The former prime minister’s return to government will be a constant reminder to voters of how long the Tories have been in power

title: Sir Keir Starmer fears for family’s safety after Labour MPs targeted with abuse
description: MPs who refused to back an SNP amendment to the King's Speech backing a ceasefire in Gaza have been targeted with abuse

title: Israel-Gaza: Protests against MPs cross a line, says Rachel Reeves
description: Some of the protests targeting MPs over the Israel-Gaza war are "crossing the line" into intimidation, the shadow chancellor Rachel Reeves has said. She made the comments after a demonstration was held in north London on Saturday close to Labour leader Sir Keir Starmer's constituency office.

title: Homes in certain UK areas to get £1,000 off bills a year under new government plans
description: People who live in certain areas of the UK will be given £1,000 off their bills a year under new government plans. Households that are situated close to new pylons and electricity substations are in line to receive the free handout, which could amount to up to £10,000 over a decade.

title: 'I don't support the intimidation of MPs' - Rachel Reeves on Gaza
description: Rachel Reeves has told the BBC that she supports the right to protest, but not the intimidation of MPs. Speaking with Laura Kuenssberg, the shadow chancellor was commenting on protests calling for a ceasefire in Gaza which targeted Labour MPs.

title: 'Great unity' in Labour over ending suffering in Israel and Gaza, Starmer says
description: Labour leader Sir Keir Starmer has told Sky News, "I think everybody in the party is concerned to do everything they can to alleviate the suffering we are seeing in Israel and Gaza. In that sense there is great unity".

title: Israel-Palestine war: Europe is following the US into another disastrous war
description: UK and EU leaders blindly following US foreign policy on Israel and Gaza obviously learned nothing from the catastrophic western interventions in Iraq and Afghanistan

title: Sarwar insists Labour MSPs will vote for Gaza ceasefire in Holyrood
description: Scottish Labour could attempt to soften a Scottish Government motion calling for an immediate ceasefire in Gaza.

title: Sir Keir Starmer says 'everyone in the Labour party' wants to 'alleviate the suffering' in Israel and Gaza
description: Sir Keir Starmer has claimed that 'all is well' in the Labour party amid growing concerns of divisions surrounding the Israel-Gaza ceasefire debate. Sir Keir has said he does not back a ceasefire because it would only "embolden" Hamas.

title: Reeves: Some protests aimed at MPs over Gaza war have ‘crossed the line’
